update.description:
This pull request introduces the first iteration of `ignition-cmake`. A detailed migration document can be found in [MIGRATION.md](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/CMakeRefactor/MIGRATION.md). I recommend viewing it with something that supports markdown.

Here's a brief overview of the advantages of converting to `ignition-cmake`:

1. Much simpler, cleaner, and more maintainable cmake scripts for each `ignition` project

2. Fixes or improvements to the build system are quickly propagated to all `ignition` projects

3. We are now automatically generating a variety of headers and files which would otherwise be a chore to maintain (e.g. we can correctly generate each project's pkgconfig and `-config.cmake` files without needing any maintenance).

4. Our packages will be fully relocatable.

5. Package and directory names will be versioned appropriately, allowing multiple major versions to be installed on a machine at the same time.

Note that this PR satisfies all the feature requests brought up [here](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-seed/issues/3/) in `ignition-seed`.

Examples of projects that use `ignition-cmake` can be found on [branch CMakeRefactor-3 of ignition-math](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/CMakeRefactor-3) (the -3 is because it targets ignition-math3) and [branch CMakeRefactor of ignition-common](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/CMakeRefactor).

content.raw:
Strictly speaking, the suffix should form part of the version like the major, minor or patch. The [semantic versioning](http://semver.org/#spec-item-9) guide recommends to use hypen \(`1.0.0-pre1`\) but Debian reserves it to release versions so debian maintainers generally use a tilde \(\`1.0.0~pre1\`\).

Answering your question, being practical, we need it at least in the packaging level to produce a tarball with the right suffix \(1.0.0 is not the same than 1.0.0-pre1\). Speaking about build system level \(cmake\), to make developers life easier we can probably think in a 1.0.0~pre1 considered like a 1.0.0 so `find_package` and other mechanism can find it and don't consider `1.0.0~pre1 < 1.0.0`\). I believe that this answer the question about the package name. Please note that this assumptions are part of our upstream role, they don't apply to a distribution packaging work where the pre, alpha and beta should be consider strictly lower than the stable release.

I've used `~pre1` above but the same applies for `~alpha` and `~beta`.

content.raw:
I think that Shane has summarized very well the problem. One minor addition: we can link two majors in the same target without using C\+\+ namespaces but using inline namespaces.

@nkoenig mentioned our talks with TRI to support two major versions at development time.  For that we will need both versioning include paths and versioning C\+\+ namespaces. I think that we can leave this use case out by now, I would like to play with a prototype first.

update.description:
This pull request introduces the first iteration of `ignition-cmake`. A detailed migration document can be found in [MIGRATION.md](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/CMakeRefactor/MIGRATION.md). I recommend viewing it with something that supports markdown.

Here's a brief overview of the advantages of converting to `ignition-cmake`:

1. Much simpler, cleaner, and more maintainable cmake scripts for each `ignition` project

2. Fixes or improvements to the build system are quickly propagated to all `ignition` projects

3. We are now automatically generating a variety of headers and files which would otherwise be a chore to maintain (e.g. we can correctly generate each project's pkgconfig and `-config.cmake` files without needing any maintenance).

4. Our packages will be fully relocatable.

5. Package and directory names will be versioned appropriately, allowing multiple major versions to be installed on a machine at the same time.

Note that this PR satisfies all the feature requests brought up [here](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-seed/issues/3/) in `ignition-seed`.

Examples of projects that use `ignition-cmake` can be found on [branch CMakeRefactor-3 of ignition-math](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/CMakeRefactor-3) (the -3 is because it targets ignition-math3) and [branch CMakeRefactor of ignition-common](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/CMakeRefactor).
